captions.text: Whiskey Brown momentarily but gently has a hold of Lucy by the lip.
I'm relaxing my hind leg, meaning absolutely nothing is bothering me.  I'm just chillin'.
Right here is where Whiskey Brown gives a hind leg kick, just for show, not trying to hurt Lucy at all.
This is good spot to slip and stumble, then regain my stride like it never happened.
Now to jump over this pile of scrap metal covered with weeds.
Time to give the "Big Shoulder" as I run by, just for show...
Right here is where my withers runs into a low pine tree limb.  It makes a loud noise but it did not hurt.
Bye Bye Lucy.  Catch me when I make the next turn.
Time to run directly at the camera guy.  Maybe I can make him flinch.   More show stuff.

comments.author: pkzadam115able

comments.text:
I've watched this 'Watch It Again' and laugh every time.  But there is a 
lot more going on here than meets the eye.  Towards the beginning of the 
clip the horse paws the ground to get down to roll - the dog recognises 
this as a bath and get in the water trough at the same time.  That is a 
really close understanding between these two,.  I notice  also that the dog 
understands that the horse has less special awareness and has the option to 
duck under the wire fence out of the way when necessary!  Great vid - will 
probably watch it again and  every so often.﻿

I wanna thank you for this awesome video. So much fun and love both at the 
same time! ❤ I deeply love the way these two are bond and play together 
carefully without hurting each other: that's amazing! Unconditional love 
for sure.

I had seen it once long ago but lost your link and I remembered it often 
wondering if I will ever see it again one day ^^ I feel lucky I find it 
today and will follow your channel now and go and see your other videos. 
Thank you again for sharing such loving moments, it warms my heart and it's 
very peaceful to watch. You are blessed to live with these two loving 
animals every day! ﻿

comments.text:

comments.author: gnomedster

comments.text:
In the long run, a pack of large wild dogs could eventually wear down a 
horse (if it was singled out of the herd) and take it for food. As this 
probably could have happened thousands of years ago.  It would take the 
dogs as a pack,  several days.  Dogs have more stamina in that aspect.  In 
a short one on one scenario, like in this video. a dog would not have a 
chance.  Lucy was so tired after this run that she had to jump in the 
horse's water just to cool off.  Whiskey Brown was just getting started.  :)

day I'll catch him just right.  Then everybody will be behooved !! :)  LOL
